contentList.content: You gain proficiency with all Melee Martial weapons that don't have the Two-Handed or Heavy property. You can use a Melee weapon with which you have proficiency as a Spellcasting Focus for your Wizard spells.

While your Bladesong is active, you gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Intelligence modifier, your Speed increases by 10 feet, you have Advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks, you can use your Intelligence modifier for weapon attack and damage rolls, and when you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain Concentration, you add your Intelligence modifier to the roll.
You can't wear Medium or Heavy Armour or use a Shield while Bladesinging. Wielding a two-handed weapon (that isn't versatile) will cancel Bladesong.

You invoke an elven magic called the Bladesong, granting you supernatural speed, agility, and focus for 10 turns.
You can't wear Medium or Heavy Armour or use a Shield while Bladesinging. Wielding a two-handed weapon (that isn't versatile) will cancel Bladesong.
